subject: Languages
title: The Dream of a Universal Language
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: The Dream of a Universal Language.

hook.text: For centuries, philosophers dreamed of one perfect language that all humans could share.

buildup.text: After Babel, the idea of a universal tongue haunted European thinkers from Descartes to Leibniz.

discovery.text: Leibniz imagined a 'characteristica universalis' â€” a logical language that made disagreement impossible.

twist.text: Every attempt failed. Language is too messy, too cultural, and too human to be perfected.

climax.text: The dream survived and inspired Esperanto, Interlingua, and even computer programming languages.

punchline.text: Humanity keeps trying to build a perfect language and keeps proving it can't.

quiz.question: What was Leibniz's 'characteristica universalis'?
options: A proposed logical language eliminating ambiguity
